channel.title: CVE Feed for Docker Inc. -- all
channel.description: The latest CVEs for Docker Inc. -- all products

item.title: CVE-2023-0627|2024-08-02T05:17:50.133Z -- docker%20inc. -- docker%20desktop
item.description: Docker Desktop 4.11.x allows --no-windows-containers flag bypass via IPC response spoofing which may lead to Local Privilege Escalation (LPE).This issue affects Docker Desktop: 4.11.X.

item.title: CVE-2023-0628|2024-08-02T05:17:50.327Z -- docker%20inc. -- docker%20desktop
item.description: Docker Desktop before 4.17.0 allows an attacker to execute an arbitrary command inside a Dev Environments container during initialization by tricking a user to open a crafted malicious docker-desktop:// URL.

item.title: CVE-2023-0625|2024-08-02T05:17:50.282Z -- docker%20inc. -- docker%20desktop
item.description:
Docker Desktop before 4.12.0 is vulnerable to RCE via a crafted extension description or changelog.
This issue affects Docker Desktop: before 4.12.0.

item.title: CVE-2023-0633|2024-08-02T05:17:50.183Z -- docker%20inc. -- docker%20desktop
item.description: In Docker Desktop on Windows before 4.12.0 an argument injection to installer may result in local privilege escalation (LPE).This issue affects Docker Desktop: before 4.12.0.

item.title: CVE-2023-0626|2024-08-02T05:17:50.222Z -- docker%20inc. -- docker%20desktop
item.description:
Docker Desktop before 4.12.0 is vulnerable to RCE via query parameters in message-box route.
This issue affects Docker Desktop: before 4.12.0.

item.title: CVE-2023-0629|2024-08-02T05:17:50.272Z -- docker%20inc. -- docker%20desktop
item.description:
Docker Desktop before 4.17.0 allows an unprivileged user to bypass Enhanced Container Isolation (ECI) restrictions by setting the Docker host to docker.raw.sock, or npipe:////.pipe/docker_engine_linux on Windows, via the -H (--host) CLI flag or the DOCKER_HOST environment variable and launch containers without the additional hardening features provided by ECI. This would not affect already running containers, nor containers launched through the usual approach (without Docker's raw socket).
The affected functionality is available for Docker Business customers only and assumes an environment where users are not granted local root or Administrator privileges. This issue has been fixed in Docker Desktop 4.17.0.
Affected Docker Desktop versions: from 4.13.0 before 4.17.0.

item.title: CVE-2024-6222|2024-08-01T03:55:55.155Z -- docker%20inc. -- docker%20desktop
item.description:
In Docker Desktop before v4.29.0, an attacker who has gained access to the Docker Desktop VM through a container breakout can further escape to the host by passing extensions and dashboard related IPC messages.
Docker Desktop v4.29.0 https://docs.docker.com/desktop/release-notes/#4290 fixes the issue on MacOS, Linux and Windows with Hyper-V backend.
As exploitation requires "Allow only extensions distributed through the Docker Marketplace" to be disabled, Docker Desktop v4.31.0 https://docs.docker.com/desktop/release-notes/#4310 additionally changes the default configuration to enable this setting by default.

item.title: CVE-2024-5652|2024-07-09T17:07:08.691Z -- docker%20inc. -- docker%20desktop
item.description: In Docker Desktop on Windows before v4.31.0 allows a user in the docker-users group to cause a Windows Denial-of-Service through the exec-path Docker daemon config option in Windows containers mode.
